thread.title: Autumn home updates

author: Talib Choudhry
title: Autumn home updates
text: Bed and board Channelling relaxed contemporary style, Murmur is the new homeware collection from leading bedding brand Bedeck. There is a good deal more than just bedlinen on offer; among the standouts are mix-and-match ceramic tableware (from £10), embroidered throws and cushions in earthy colours (from £35) and a great range of kitchen accessories including wooden boards and bowls (from £31). Available at murmur.co.uk from September 10. Hot to trot These porcelain travel mugs by the American fashion designer Vera Wang for Wedgwood are so stylish I might invest in one for teatime al-desko. Double-walled for insulation, they come in seven inky designs, each with a reusable silicone lid. They are £18 each and avaliable from late September. Next wave On Monday Achica will launch a range of accessories from five British design graduates, giving them a direct route to market. My favourites are Camilla Lee’s beautiful lo-fi ceramic and terracotta i-Phone amplifiers (£125), which sound as good as they look. Leading lights Skinflint Design specialises in sourcing salvaged 20th-century lighting, mainly from Eastern Europe – think 1950s Czechoslovakian machinist lamps and German rail-station lights. Each piece is refurbished to modern technological standards and ready to use. The light shown here is £528, skinflintdesign.co.uk. Give it a swirl Clients for Emma D’Arcey’s exuberant marbled patterns include Parisian luxury label Hermès, fashion designer Stella McCartney, and fabric house Zoffany. Her latest venture is a tableware range for Avenida Home with these eye-catching trays (Large, £39, small, £29) telegraph.co.uk Follow @telegraph
